description: This graph represents the Static Analysis Engine, which performs deep static analysis of a codebase. Its main flow involves initiating scans, coordinating language-specific analysis, extracting structural information, building call graphs, identifying class hierarchies, and determining package dependencies across multiple languages. The engine orchestrates this detailed analysis process by leveraging various specialized components and stores comprehensive raw analysis results.

components.name: Static Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Manages the overall static analysis workflow, initiating scans, coordinating language-specific analysis, and overseeing the collection and storage of results. It acts as the primary entry point for the Static Analysis Engine.

components.name: LSP Client Interface
components.description: Provides a generic, low-level communication layer for interacting with Language Server Protocol (LSP) servers, handling requests, responses, and extracting fundamental code intelligence like symbols, definitions, and references.

components.name: Language-Specific LSP Adapters
components.description: Specialized clients for specific programming languages (e.g., Java, TypeScript) that manage their respective LSP server lifecycles, handle language-specific initialization, and process code intelligence. The Java adapter specifically utilizes `static_analyzer.java_utils.JavaUtils` for environment setup.

components.name: Codebase Scanner & Config Parser
components.description: Scans the repository to identify programming languages, file types, and provides statistics on codebase composition. It also detects and parses language-specific configuration files (e.g., Maven `pom.xml`, Gradle `build.gradle` for Java; `tsconfig.json` for TypeScript) to understand the project's build and module structure.

components.name: Analysis Result Store
components.description: A central repository for storing, caching, and retrieving all static analysis data, including call graphs, class hierarchies, source file information, and resolved references, ensuring efficient data access.

components.name: Call Graph Builder & Component Clusterer
components.description: Constructs a comprehensive call graph from the extracted code relationships and applies various clustering algorithms to identify logical components and their interdependencies within the codebase.

components.name: Reference Resolver
components.description: Resolves ambiguous or incomplete code references by attempting various matching strategies, including exact matches and file path inference, to ensure accurate linking of all identified code relationships.

components.name: Language Configuration Manager
components.description: Manages and provides access to configuration and properties for each supported programming language, including their file extensions, LSP server commands, and specific analysis requirements.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Performs deep static analysis of the codebase, extracting structural information, building call graphs, identifying class hierarchies, and determining package dependencies across multiple languages. It stores comprehensive raw analysis results. This engine orchestrates the detailed analysis process by leveraging the specialized components below.
